channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Democrats Divided Over Biden, and Israeli Strike Hits School Shelter
Middle East Crisis: At Least 25 Reported Killed in Israeli Airstrike in Southern Gaza
item.description: Gaza health authorities said dozens more were injured, many critically. Israel said that it was targeting a Hamas member who had taken part in the Oct. 7 attacks and that it was investigating reports of civilian casualties.

item.title: Europe faces a summer of diaper and tampon shortages as new EU deforestation laws threaten to disrupt the $3.5 billion industry
item.description: The Union aims to slash 10% of global deforestation through its new law which is impacting manufacturers such as P&G and Kimberly-Clark.

item.title: This May Be a Turning Point for Biden. But in Which Direction?
item.description: The race against Trump doesn’t seem as if it will get easier.

item.title: Rwanda Says It Doesn’t Have to Repay UK for Scrapped Migration Plan
item.description: Britain gave Rwanda hundreds of millions of pounds, even though no asylum seekers were deported to the Central African nation under the agreement.

item.title: Stranded by sanctions: 53 Russian oil tankers are currently drifting empty and idle across the globe
item.description: The vessels have become inactive after being hit with U.S., U.K. and European sanctions.

item.title: FEMA Imposes Building Rules to Reduce Flood Damage
item.description: New restrictions are meant to reduce damage during floods. The rules were first proposed in 2016, then the Trump administration scrapped them.

item.title: A Biden Confidant Emerges as a Crucial Mideast Diplomat
item.description: Amos Hochstein, an energy policy official who was born in Israel, is playing diplomatic firefighter along the Israel-Lebanon border.

item.title: ‘All workers deserve a union’: Ride-hailing drivers in Massachusetts are advancing a first-of-its-kind ballot question to gain union rights
item.description: April Verritt, president of the Service Employees International Union, said the tens of thousands of Uber and Lyft drivers working in Massachusetts deserve the collective bargaining benefits of unions.

item.title: Rising Frustration in Houston After Millions Lost Power in Storm
item.description: With outages expected to last days, a top state official promised to look into whether the utility company could have done more to prepare for Hurricane Beryl.

item.title: Wednesday Briefing
item.description: Biden at the NATO summit in Washington.

item.title: Sicily’s summer drought is so acute this year that it’s drying up lakes and forcing cities to turn away tourists because they don’t have enough water
item.description: Climate change is hurting the Italian island of Sicily in various ways—from record-high heat and shrinking water reserves.

item.title: Trump’s V.P. Reveal May Be This Week. Or Not.
item.description: Donald J. Trump’s monthslong search for a running mate, orchestrated to feed speculation and attention, is nearing an end, but questions of who, and when, remain.

item.title: Euro 2024’s Best Party Invite: Meet at the Bus. And Wear Orange.
item.description: With thousands of voices and a few well-choreographed dance moves, Dutch fans have transformed match days into pulsing, joyous celebrations. Their next one is Wednesday.

item.title: NATO needs help reaching Gen Z so is turning to 20-something TikTok and Instagram influencers from the U.K. and Europe to stay relevant
item.description: Aging institutions like NATO increasingly need to think outside the box to bolster public support.
